alert.note: Alert for Hocking; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 6:53AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN HOCKING, SOUTHEASTERN PICKAWAY AND EASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 715 AM EDT... At 651 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Kingston to Bourneville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Logan, Kingston, Hocking Hills State Park, North Folk Village, Londonderry, Laurelville, Adelphi, Bourneville, Andersonville, Gibisonville, Mooresville, Lake Logan State Park, Whisler, South Bloomingville, Summithill, Knockemstiff, Richmond Dale, Massieville and Hallsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
